holidays.name: Opposite Day
holidays.description: A playful day where everything you say or do is the opposite of what you mean, creating hilarious confusion and mischief all around!
holidays.origin: The exact origin is unclear, but it became popular among schoolchildren and in pop culture as a day to mix things up.
holidays.funFact: Some schools and workplaces join in on Opposite Day antics, leading to topsy-turvy meetings and reverse conversations!

holidays.name: Compliment Day
holidays.description: Ditch the grump and spread some joy by giving genuine compliments to friends, family, or even strangers.
holidays.origin: Started in the late 20th century to encourage kindness and positive communication.
holidays.funFact: A simple compliment can boost someone‚Äôs mood and even improve their productivity for the day!

holidays.name: National Peanut Butter Day
holidays.description: A crunchy, creamy celebration dedicated to one of America's favorite spreads ‚Äì peanut butter!
holidays.origin: Established in the US to honor this beloved pantry staple, enjoyed in sandwiches, desserts, and snacks.
holidays.funFact: Americans consume over 270 million pounds of peanut butter annually, enough to spread on 72 million sandwiches daily!

holidays.name: Burro Day
holidays.description: A quirky festival held in Ignacio, Colorado, celebrating the humble burro with races, costume contests, and local crafts.
holidays.origin: Honors the burros that were essential pack animals during the mining days in the 1800s.
holidays.funFact: Burro Day draws visitors who come to cheer on these sure-footed pack animals and enjoy a slice of heritage!
